intro: Adenocarpus boudyi var. pilosus, commonly known as the hairy false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the dandelion family. It thrives in grasslands and open habitats, often growing in dry conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
